cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi (160 km) SE of Fort Lauderdale, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north-northwest along the Florida east coast tonight and Sunday, then turn north and pass just offshore the Georgia coast Monday before accelerating north-northeast toward the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of South Carolina/North Carolina border region

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Boca Raton to Volusia/Flagler County Line, FL; Tropical Storm Warning: Volusia/Flagler County Line to Ponte Vedra Beach, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. shoreline from south Florida through coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Monday as the center passes offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–3 ft above ground level possible along the Georgia coast, depending on exact track.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Monday–Tuesday with localized ponding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents affecting vessel approaches and pilot boarding areas.
